benchmark_details.name: TUR[K]INGBENCH
benchmark_details.overview: TURKING BENCH is a benchmark consisting of tasks presented as web pages with textual instructions and multi-modal contexts, aimed at evaluating models' ability to perform complex web-based tasks found on crowdsourcing platforms.
benchmark_details.data_type: web-based tasks with textual and visual instructions

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized evaluation for web-based agents and facilitate research on multimodal interactive web-based tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark is limited to tasks involving data annotation and does not require navigation between web pages.

data.source: Crowdsourced tasks from Amazon Mechanical Turk
data.format: HTML with integrated text and visual elements
data.annotation: Annotated output labels provided by crowd workers

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the type of input field: ROUGE for text fields, exact match for radio/select fields, intersection over union for checkbox fields, and L1 distance for range fields.
methodology.interpretation: Scores are averaged across different field types to assess model performance.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT4 achieved a top score of 41.7%, significantly above random chance but below the maximum achievable performance.
methodology.validation: Evaluation is conducted iteratively, where models interact with web pages and provide responses to input fields.
